page.title: 14LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Ours is a laww abiding community as we have very little crime. The most common crime in 1984 was housebreaking. We had 22 cases. We also had 15 cases of breaking in with nothing stolen. 15 cases of simple theft and 8 cars were broken into. The figures for this year so far are very much lower. Most of the breakins happened to large houses which were isolated and were sheltered by trees etc. giving the thieves maximum cover. Modern thieves travel in cars or vans and usually come from the city. They are well organised and take either money or goods that are easily sold. They look just like anyone else. There is a lot of poaching in the area,mainly for fish and hares. Again the poachers use transport and make a lot of money selling their catch.
